steps.title: AVERAGE Function
steps.content:
Using AVERAGE in Excel

For this set of activities, you will need the Sports Day Fundraiser file.

The AVERAGE function calculates the arithmetic mean of a range of numbers.

Example:

=AVERAGE(H2:H21)

This calculates the average donation from the range H2:H21

Step-by-Step Guide:

  1. Select your target cell
  2. Type =AVERAGE(
  3. Select the 'Optional raffle donation' column range H2:H21
  4. Close the parenthesis )
  5. Press Enter

quiz.question: If you have donation amounts of $5, $10, $0, $15, and $20, what will =AVERAGE(H2:H6) return?

steps.title: COUNTIF Function
steps.content:
Counting with Conditions

The COUNTIF function helps analyze how many entries match specific criteria.

Formula Examples:

=COUNTIF(E2:E21, "L")

Count Large T-shirts

=COUNTIF(G2:G21, ">4")

Count large group bookings

=COUNTIF(I2:I21, "Yes")

Count newsletter subscribers

Common Criteria Operators:

  • ">100" Greater than
  • "<50" Less than
  • ">=20" Greater or equal
  • "=Text" Exact match
  • "*text*" Contains text
  • "<>No" Not equal to

quiz.question: To count how many people donated more than $20, which formula would you use?

steps.title: IF Function
steps.content:
Making Decisions with IF

The IF function performs logical tests and returns different values based on whether the test is TRUE or FALSE.

Formula Examples:

=IF(G2>3, "Large Group", "Small Group")

Classify group sizes based on attendance

=IF(H2>15, "High Donor", "Regular Donor")

Categorise donors based on donation amount

quiz.question: What will =IF(H2>10, "Thank You", "Welcome") return for a $15 donation?

steps.title: Conditional Formatting
steps.content:
Visualizing Fundraiser Data

Step-by-Step Guide:

  1. Select your data range (e.g., H2:H21 for donations)
  2. Go to the Home tab in the Excel ribbon
  3. Click the Conditional Formatting button
  5. Choose your rule type:
    • Highlight Cells Rules → Greater Than → Enter $20 for high donations
    • Color Scales → Red-Yellow-Green for booking distributions
    • Data Bars → Gradient Fill for visual donation comparisons
  6. Customise your format styles in the dialog box

Recommended Rules for Our Dataset:

Donations

  • Green for >$20
  • Yellow for $10-$20
  • Red for <$10

Group Sizes

  • Data bars for visual comparison
  • Icon sets for capacity warnings
